text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Women's History Museum

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report containing the recommendations of the

with respect to a
			 plan of action for the establishment and maintenance of a National Women’s
			 History Museum in Washington, DC.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Women's History Museum

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Women's History Museum

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report that addresses the following issues:

text.#text: The

The availability
			 and cost of collections to be acquired and housed in the Museum.

The impact of the
			 Museum on regional women history-related museums.

Potential
			 locations for the Museum in Washington, DC, and its environs (including the
			 location located on public land bounded by Independence Avenue SW., 14th Street
			 SW., 15th Street SW., and Jefferson Drive SW., in Washington, DC, that is
			 established subject to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: chapter 89 of title 40, United States Code
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: usc-chapter/40/89
Commemorative Works Act

text.#text:
Whether the
			 Museum should be part of the Smithsonian Institution.

The governance
			 and organizational structure from which the Museum should operate.

Best practices
			 for engaging women in the development and design of the Museum.

The cost of
			 constructing, operating, and maintaining the Museum.
